item.title: Gideon the Ninth
item.description: WOULD HAVE HARROWHARK’S BABIES. I mean, it’s a good thing I like nice people in real life, because in fiction, Harrowhark is 10000% my type.

item.title: Harrow the Ninth
item.description: Amount of times this book made me cry: [redacted]. It is a sum equal to or only slightly less than the amount of times it made me cackle, gasp, and yelp.

item.title: Bitter
item.description: Is this even better than [[books/pet|Pet]]? Holy crap, I think so. The struggle. The hope. The tenderness. It knocked me sideways.

item.title: Nona the Ninth
item.description: Verdict still stands after book three: would have Harrowhark’s babies. The end of [[books/gideon the ninth|Gideon]] had some pacing things, the start of [[books/harrow the ninth|Harrow]] had some pacing things; Nona was the one I barreled through in 1.

item.title: What My Bones Know
item.description: Incredible memoir. One of the best books I’ve read about healing from abuse, dysfunction, and trauma. So much to relate to on every page (and not just because she had the same Jimmy Eat World song as a lifeline in the early aughts).

item.title: Among Others
item.description: “[[notes/bibliotropic|Bibliotropic]],” Hugh said. “Like sunflowers are heliotropic, they naturally turn towards the sun. We naturally turn towards the bookshop.”

item.title: Everyone in This Room Will Someday Be Dead
item.description: This is the most strongly coded [[notes/autism|autistic]] protagonist I’ve read. Especially of the female, high-masking, chronic burnout variety, and undiagnosed. (Or rather, insufficiently diagnosed with anxiety and depression.

item.title: Exodus 20
item.description: If you’re gonna write monster kink, make it a biblically accurate angel. And throw in some searing social/political/theological commentary. This was excellent.

item.title: Interesting Facts about Space
item.description: Me [page 1]: I’m worried I read too much about [[notes/autism|ASD]] into [[books/everyone in this room will someday be dead|Everyone in This Room Will Someday be Dead]].
